title: Why don’t people understand that they are biologically programmed to form groups and fight to prevail over other groups rather than cooperate because our ancestors had to defend the tribe’s feeding territory or die? - Quora

response.answer_text: We know that. It's just that some of us are capable of higher thought than "life is a battlefield". We don't want to fight all the time. Fighting sucks. We want to cooperate. In the US, we're called Libtards. Let the conservatives fight each other!

So it is ok to be racist because we did that when we still lived in caves? that is a pretty weak argument, we did a lot of things in the past because of biological or evolutionary reasons, not all of these things are done anymore, common examples of this include sleeping with as many woman as possible as a man to father children and that is not a thing anymore for centuries, most families are a single woman and a man with a few children who are more or less faithful to each other.
